isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD REMOVAL - CLEANING

step1.para: With the valves installed to protect the seats, remove deposits and gasket material from the gasket surface of the cylinder head using a rotary wire brush or sanding block with mineral spirits. BE SURE INJECTION NOZZLES ARE REMOVED BEFORE WIRE BRUSHING, TO PREVENT INJECTION NOZZLE DAMAGE. REFER TO SECTION 12.
Clean all bolt holes with appropriate size tap. Clear debris from bolt holes, oil return and water passages, using filtered compressed air.
Clean the cylinder head bolt threads.
Wash all bolts and washers with a suitable solvent and dry thoroughly.

note.para: Dirt in threads or damaged threads may cause binding and result in a false torque reading.
